TEXT.TITLE: INTEL, MATRA-HARRIS DISSOLVE CIMATEL PARTNERSHIP
TEXT.BODY: Intel Corp <INTC> of Santa Clara, Calif. And Matra-Harris-Semiconducteurs (MHS) said their Cimatel joint venture design facility was dissolved as from June 1. Intel makes logic and memory components. MHS is a joint venture of the Matra group <MATR.PA> and Harris Corp <HRS>. Cimatel was formed in 1982 to design standard VLSI devices for the telecommunications and computer graphics markets. MHS said in a statement that changing market conditions had led Intel to reassess its marketing policy. It had concluded that without common marketing goals a common design centre was impractical. REUTER
